flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=25>>25 photos.
When Tim has 25 photos, then Paul has 25 + 10 photos = <<25+10=35>>35 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 25 photos + 35 photos = <<25+35=60>>60 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 60 photos = <<152-60=92>>92 photos.
#### 92

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 52, not 25. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
